verses.verse: And the <S%H1121>sons<s%> of the <S%H5030>prophets<s%> <S%H559>said<s%> <S%H6440>unto<s%> <S%H477>Elisha<s%>, Behold <S%H4725>now<s%>, the place where we <S%H3427>dwell<s%> before thee is too strait for <S%H6862>us<s%>.

Let us <S%H3212>go<s%>, we pray <S%H3383>thee<s%>, unto the Jordan, and <S%H3947>take<s%> thence every <S%H376>man<s%> <S%H259>a<s%> <S%H6982>beam<s%>, and let us <S%H6213>make<s%> us a <S%H4725>place<s%> <S%H3427>there<s%>, where we may dwell. And he <S%H559>answered<s%>, Go <S%H3212>ye<s%>.
And <S%H259>one<s%> <S%H559>said<s%>, Be <S%H2974>pleased<s%>, I pray <S%H3212>thee<s%>, to go with thy <S%H5650>servants<s%>. And he <S%H559>answered<s%>, I will <S%H3212>go<s%>.
So he <S%H3212>went<s%> with <S%H935>them<s%>. And when they came to the <S%H3383>Jordan<s%>, they cut <S%H1504>down<s%> <S%H6086>wood<s%>.

But as <S%H259>one<s%> was <S%H5307>felling<s%> a <S%H6982>beam<s%>, the <S%H1270>axe-head<s%> <S%H5307>fell<s%> into the <S%H4325>water<s%>; and he <S%H6817>cried<s%>, and <S%H559>said<s%>, <S%H162>Alas<s%>, my <S%H113>master<s%>! for it was <S%H7592>borrowed<s%>.

And the <S%H376>man<s%> of <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H559>said<s%>, <S%H575>Where<s%> <S%H5307>fell<s%> <S%H7200>it<s%>? And he showed him the <S%H4725>place<s%>. And he cut <S%H7094>down<s%> a <S%H6086>stick<s%>, and <S%H7993>cast<s%> it in <S%H1270>thither<s%>, and made the iron to <S%H6687>swim<s%>.
And he <S%H559>said<s%>, Take it <S%H7311>up<s%> to <S%H7971>thee<s%>. So he put out his <S%H3027>hand<s%>, and took <S%H3947>it<s%>.

Now the <S%H4428>king<s%> of <S%H758>Syria<s%> was <S%H3898>warring<s%> against <S%H3478>Israel<s%>; and he took <S%H3289>counsel<s%> with his <S%H5650>servants<s%>, <S%H559>saying<s%>, In <S%H492>such<s%> and <S%H6423>such<s%> a <S%H4725>place<s%> shall be my <S%H8466>camp<s%>.

And <S%H259>one<s%> of his <S%H5650>servants<s%> <S%H559>said<s%>, <S%H113>Nay<s%>, my lord, O <S%H4428>king<s%>; but <S%H477>Elisha<s%>, the <S%H5030>prophet<s%> that is in <S%H3478>Israel<s%>, <S%H5046>telleth<s%> the <S%H4428>king<s%> of <S%H3478>Israel<s%> the <S%H1697>words<s%> that thou <S%H1696>speakest<s%> in thy <S%H2315>bedchamber<s%>.

And when the <S%H8334>servant<s%> of the <S%H376>man<s%> of <S%H430>God<s%> was <S%H6965>risen<s%> <S%H7925>early<s%>, and gone <S%H3318>forth<s%>, <S%H2428>behold<s%>, a host with <S%H5483>horses<s%> and <S%H7393>chariots<s%> was round <S%H5437>about<s%> the <S%H5892>city<s%>. And his <S%H5288>servant<s%> <S%H559>said<s%> unto <S%H162>him<s%>, Alas, my <S%H113>master<s%>! how shall we <S%H6213>do<s%>?

And <S%H477>Elisha<s%> <S%H6419>prayed<s%>, and <S%H559>said<s%>, <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%>, I pray <S%H6491>thee<s%>, open his <S%H5869>eyes<s%>, that he may <S%H7200>see<s%>. And <S%H477>Elisha<s%> <S%H559>said<s%> unto <S%H1870>them<s%>, This is not the way, neither is <S%H2090>this<s%> the <S%H5892>city<s%>: <S%H3212>follow<s%> <S%H3212>me<s%>, and I will bring you to the <S%H376>man<s%> whom ye <S%H1245>seek<s%>. And he <S%H3212>led<s%> them to <S%H8111>Samaria<s%>.

And it came to <S%H935>pass<s%>, when they were come into <S%H8111>Samaria<s%>, that <S%H477>Elisha<s%> <S%H559>said<s%>, <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%>, <S%H6491>open<s%> the <S%H5869>eyes<s%> of these <S%H7200>men<s%>, that they may see. And the <S%H4428>king<s%> of <S%H3478>Israel<s%> <S%H559>said<s%> unto <S%H477>Elisha<s%>, when he <S%H7200>saw<s%> <S%H1>them<s%>, My father, shall I <S%H5221>smite<s%> <S%H5221>them<s%>? shall I smite them?

And he <S%H559>answered<s%>, Thou shalt not <S%H5221>smite<s%> <S%H5221>them<s%>: wouldest thou smite those whom thou hast taken <S%H7617>captive<s%> with thy <S%H2719>sword<s%> and with thy <S%H7198>bow<s%>? <S%H7760>set<s%> <S%H3899>bread<s%> and <S%H4325>water<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> <S%H398>them<s%>, that they may eat and <S%H8354>drink<s%>, and <S%H3212>go<s%> to their <S%H113>master<s%>.

And he <S%H3739>prepared<s%> <S%H1419>great<s%> <S%H3740>provision<s%> for <S%H398>them<s%>; and when they had eaten and <S%H8354>drunk<s%>, he sent them <S%H7971>away<s%>, and they <S%H3212>went<s%> to their <S%H113>master<s%>. And she answered, This <S%H802>woman<s%> <S%H559>said<s%> unto <S%H5414>me<s%>, Give thy <S%H1121>son<s%>, that we may <S%H398>eat<s%> him <S%H3117>to-day<s%>, and we will <S%H398>eat<s%> my <S%H1121>son<s%> <S%H4279>to-morrow<s%>.

And it came to <S%H4428>pass<s%>, when the king <S%H8085>heard<s%> the <S%H1697>words<s%> of the <S%H802>woman<s%>, that he <S%H7167>rent<s%> his <S%H899>clothes<s%> (now he was passing <S%H5674>by<s%> upon the <S%H2346>wall<s%>); and the <S%H5971>people<s%> <S%H7200>looked<s%>, <S%H8242>and<s%>, behold, he had sackcloth <S%H1004>within<s%> upon his <S%H1320>flesh<s%>.
